Forcing Variables to be Categorical






data-vis


plotnine


snippet



Plotnine will treat numeric quantities as continuous, and generators continuous legends. We can use ‘factor’ to force the variable to be treated as cateogrical.

title: Forcing Variables to be Categorical
text:
Problem
Plotnine assumes that numeric variables are continuous, rather than discrete.

import plotnine as p9
from plotnine.data import mtcars 

# Example without factor, cylinders are discrete but the color scale is 
# continuous 
(
    p9.ggplot(mtcars, p9.aes(x='mpg', y='wt', color='cyl'))
    + p9.geom_point()
    + p9.theme_bw()
)








Using "factor(cyl)" to force the integer number of cylinders to be seen as discrete, even though it is a numeric variable.


(
    p9.ggplot(mtcars, p9.aes(x='mpg', y='wt', color='factor(cyl)'))
    + p9.geom_point()
    + p9.theme_bw()
)









(
    p9.ggplot(mtcars, p9.aes(x='mpg', y='wt', color='factor(cyl)'))
    + p9.geom_point()
    + p9.theme_bw()
    + p9.scale_color_discrete(name="Cylinders")
)
